00032 #include "process.h"
00033 
00034 Process::Process (QStringList args, QString exec, QString dir, QString info, QString caption, QStringList env , QWidget * parent, Qt::WFlags f)
00035 {
00036     setupUi(this);
00037 
00038     myProcess = new QProcess(parent);
00039     myProcess->setEnvironment(env);
00040     connect(myProcess, SIGNAL(finished(int, QProcess::ExitStatus)), this, SLOT(slotFinished(int, QProcess::ExitStatus)));
00041     connect(myProcess, SIGNAL(error(QProcess::ProcessError)), this, SLOT(slotError(QProcess::ProcessError)));
00042     connect(cmdCancel, SIGNAL(clicked()), this, SLOT(cmdCancel_clicked()));
00043 
00044     lblInfo->setText(info);
00045     setWindowTitle(caption);
00046 
00047     myProcess->setWorkingDirectory (dir);
00048     myProcess->start(exec, args);
00049 
00050     return;
00051 }
00052 
00053 void Process::cmdCancel_clicked(void){
00054     myProcess->kill();
00055     reject();
00056     return;
00057 }
00058 
00059 void Process::slotError(QProcess::ProcessError err){
00060     if (myProcess->exitCode()!=0){
00061 
00062         QString lang;
00063         // Getting env LANG variable
00064         lang = getenv("LANG");
00065         lang = lang.split(".").at(1);
00066 
00067         if (lang.isNull())
00068             lang = "UTF8";
00069 
00070         QTextCodec *codec = QTextCodec::codecForName(lang.toAscii());
00071             QString string = codec->toUnicode(myProcess->readAllStandardError());
00072 
00073             if (!string.isEmpty()){
00074                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("It seems procces fail.<br><br>Error log:<br>%1").arg(string));
00075             } else {
00076                     switch (err){
00077                         case 0:
00078                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The process failed to start. Either the invoked program is missing, or you may have insufficient permissions to invoke the program."));
00079                         break;
00080                         case 1:
00081                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The process crashed some time after starting successfully."));
00082                         break;
00083                         case 2:
00084                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The last waitFor...() function timed out."));
00085                         break;
00086                         case 3:
00087                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An error occurred when attempting to read from the process. For example, the process may not be running."));
00088                         break;
00089                         case 4:
00090                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An error occurred when attempting to write to the process. For example, the process may not be running, or it may have closed its input channel."));
00091                         break;
00092                         case 5:
00093                             QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An unknown error occurred. This is the default return value of error()."));
00094                         break;
00095                     }
00096             }
00097     } else {
00098         switch (err){
00099             case 0:
00100                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The process failed to start. Either the invoked program is missing, or you may have insufficient permissions to invoke the program."));
00101             break;
00102             case 1:
00103                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The process crashed some time after starting successfully."));
00104             break;
00105             case 2:
00106                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: The last waitFor...() function timed out."));
00107             break;
00108             case 3:
00109                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An error occurred when attempting to read from the process. For example, the process may not be running."));
00110             break;
00111             case 4:
00112                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An error occurred when attempting to write to the process. For example, the process may not be running, or it may have closed its input channel."));
00113             break;
00114             case 5:
00115                 QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Error"), tr("Process: An unknown error occurred. This is the default return value of error()."));
00116                 break;
00117         }
00118 
00119 
00120     reject ();
00121 
00122               }
00123     return;
00124 }
00125 
00126 void Process::slotFinished(int, QProcess::ExitStatus exitc){
00127 
00128     /*
00129      * This piece of code try to catch error messages.
00130      * In fact exitCode() not always can return error code
00131      * (for example kdesu\gksu)
00132      * So the beast way is to inform user about any STDERR messages.
00133      */
00134 
00135     //      if (myProcess->exitCode()!=0){
00136     // Getting env LANG variable
00137     QString lang;
00138        lang = getenv("LANG");
00139        lang = lang.split(".").at(1);
00140 
00141     // If in is empty -- set UTF8 locale
00142     if (lang.isEmpty())
00143        lang = "UTF8";
00144 
00145     // Read STDERR with locale support
00146     QTextCodec *codec = QTextCodec::codecForName(lang.toAscii());
00147     QString string = codec->toUnicode(myProcess->readAllStandardError());
00148 
00149     if (!string.isEmpty()){
00150        if (exitc == 0){
00151         QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Output"), tr("It seems the process exited normally.<br><br>STDERR log:<br>%1").arg(string));
00152        } else {
00153         QMessageBox::warning(this, tr("Output"), tr("It seems the process crashed.<br><br>STDERR log:<br>%1").arg(string));
00154        }
00155     }
00156     accept();
00157     return;
00158 }
